{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with blockade, nasal discharge, diplopia, facial swelling, blackish discharge from the nasal cavity with necrosis of nasal mucosa, facial skin, and palate. There is fixation of the right globe, elevated blood sugar, and positive urinary ketones. Based on these symptoms, it's likely that the patient has a severe fungal infection affecting the nasal cavity and surrounding tissues. Given the presence of necrosis and blackish discharge, Amphotericin B would be the medication of choice to treat this condition.", "answer_choice": A}
